page.title: 08The Community of Weston
page.content:
Weston currently has an adult {population}of 359. The village is in the Banbury Parliamentary{Constituency and has a Conservative MP. It belongs to the Yarnton and Otmoor County Council electoral division and comes under Kirtlington{District Council. Weston has its own Parish Council which meets once a month.
Compared with neighbouring villages, Weston is well endowed with{amenities having a village shop cum post office, a village hall, two public houses, a hotel, and a garage, not to mention the two churches. The village hall was built in 1973 and provides ample accommodation and facilities for both community activities and private parties. Villagers are now raising money to provide a recreation ground. The nearest health centre is at Islip.
